TEI:
Kalittokai 39.
itu “muṉṉilai yaṟaṉeṉap paṭutaleṉ ṟiruvakaip – puraitīr kiḷavi tāyiṭaip pukuppiṉum” (to.po.114) eṉṉum viti paṟṟit tamar varaivu maṟuttuḻit tōḻi tāykku aṟattoṭu niṟpa, avaḷ taṉṉaiyar mutaliyōrkku aṟattoṭu niṟpa, avarum oruvāṟṟāṉ uṭaṉpaṭṭamai tōḻi talaivikkuk kūṟit, tāṉum avaḷum varaivu kaṭitiṉ muṭitaṟporuṭṭu varaiyuṟai teyvattiṟkuk kuravaiyāṭa avaṉ varaiyavarukiṉṟamai tōḻi talaivikku uraittatu.
kāmar kaṭumpuṉal kalantemmō ṭāṭuvā
ṭāmaraikkaṇ putaittañcit taḷarntataṉō ṭoḻukalā
ṉīṇāka naṟuntaṇṭār tayaṅkappāyn taruḷiṉāṟ
pūṇāka muṟattaḻīip pōtantā ṉakaṉakalam
varumulai puṇarntaṉa veṉpataṉā leṉṟōḻi
yarumaḻai taralvēṇṭiṟ ṟarukiṟkum perumaiyaḷē;
avaṉuntāṉ, ēṉa litaṇat takiṟpukai yuṇṭiyaṅkum
vāṉūr matiyam varaicēri ṉavvarait
tēṉi ṉiṟāleṉa vēṇi yiḻaittirukkuṅ
kāṉaka ṉāṭaṉ makaṉ;
ciṟukuṭi yīrē ciṟukuṭi yīrē
vaḷḷi kīḻvīḻā varaimicait tēṉṟoṭā
kollai kuralvāṅki yīṉā malaivāḻna
ralla purintoḻuka lāṉ;
kāntaḷ kaṭikamaḻuṅ kaṇvāṅ kiruñcilampiṉ
vāṅkamai meṉṟōṭ kuṟavar maṭamakaḷir
tāmpiḻaiyār kēḷvart toḻuteḻalāṟ ṟammaiyarun
tāmpiḻaiyār tāntoṭutta kōl;
eṉavāṅku,
aṟattoṭu niṉṟēṉaik kaṇṭu tiṟappaṭa
veṉṉaiyark kuytturaittāḷ yāy;
avarun, terikaṇai nōkkic cilainōkkik kaṇcēn
torupaka lellā murutteḻun tāṟi
yiruvarkaṭ kuṟṟa millaiyā leṉṟu
terumantu cāyttār talai;
teriyiḻāy nīyuniṉ kēḷum puṇara
varaiyuṟai teyva muvappa vuvantu
kuravai taḻīiyā māṭak kuravaiyuṭ
koṇṭu nilaipāṭik kāṇ;
nallāy,
naṉṉā ṭalaivaru mellai namarmalait
tannāṇṭān tāṅkuvā reṉṉōṟ ṟaṉarkol;
puṉavēṅkait tātuṟaikkum poṉṉaṟai muṉṟi
ṉaṉaviṟ puṇarcci naṭakkumā maṉṟō
naṉaviṟ puṇarcci naṭakkalu māṅkē
kaṉaviṟ puṇarcci kaṭitumā maṉṟō;
viṇṭōykaṉ ṉāṭaṉu nīyum vatuvaiyuṭ
paṇṭaṟiyā tīrpōṟ paṭarkiṟpīr maṟkolō
paṇṭaṟiyā tīrpōṟ paṭarntīr paḻaṅkēṇmai
kaṇṭaṟiyā tēṉpōṟ karakkiṟpeṉ maṟkolō;
maitavaḻ veṟpaṉ maṇavaṇi kāṇāmaṟ
kaiyāṟ putaipeṟūuṅ kaṇṇuṅ kaṇṇō;
eṉṉaimaṉ, niṉkaṇṇāṟ kāṇpeṉmaṉ yāṉ;
neyta litaḻuṇkaṇ, niṉkaṇṇā keṉkaṇmaṉa;
eṉavāṅku,
neṟiyaṟi ceṟikuṟi puritiri paṟiyā vaṟivaṉai muntuṟīit
takaimiku tokaivakai yaṟiyuñ cāṉṟava riṉamāka
vēypurai meṉṟōṭ pacalaiyu mampalu
māyap puṇarcciyu mellā muṭaṉīṅkac
cēyuyar veṟpaṉum vantaṉaṉ
pūveḻi luṇkaṇum polikamā viṉiyē.
She who bathed with us, mingling in the desirable fast flood,
because of her slipping [and] flowing on with it, out of fear covering [her] lotus eyes,
the one who went [by], out of grace leaping [in], so that [his] fragrant cool garland
of long gamboge swayed, [and] embracing [her] to touch [his] ornamented bosom,
because of the talk that [her] coming breasts united with [his] wide chest, my friend
is one with the greatness able to give rare rain when giving is necessary.
He too is the son one one from the wide land of forests,
where, when the moon that climbs the sky, in which the smoke of eagle wood
is absorbed [and] stirs, joins the mountain, on that mountain
they keep building ladders thinking [there are] combs of honey.
Oh you of the small hamlet, you of the small hamlet!
creepers do not descend down, honey does not touch the height of the mountain,
ears are not brought forth, bending, in the clearing, because those who live in the mountains
conduct themselves by doing untoward things.
The youthful women of the hill people with soft shoulder [like] bending bamboo
from the vast mountain side that drags the eye when the scent of Malabar lily pervades,
because of their rising in worship of [their] husbands who are without fault, their kin too
do not fail with the arrows they link [to their bows].
That is to say,
having seen me standing up with virtue, appropriately
mother sent to our people [and] talked [to them].
They too, after looking at [their] clear arrows, looking at [their] bows, [their] eyes turning red,
for one day, rising in anger, they calmed down [and],
saying “there is not fault in the two,”
the bowed [their] heads in confusion.
You with clear jewels, when you too and your friend join,
rejoicing when the mountain-dwelling deity rejoices,
when we dance, embracing in the Kuravai dance,
sing [and] see Kuravai song in the Kuravai dance.
Good one,
until [this] comes to pass on a good day, on the mountain, our people
they will endure their shame – what penance did they do?
In the frontyard with rocks golden where the pollen of the field kino tree drips,
there [our] union will take place for real, won’t it?
As soon as [our] union will take place for real, then
[our] union in dream we will discard too, won’t it?
The man from a land of sky-touching stone and you, on [your] wedding,
will you be able to set out like people who did not know each other before?
The old intimacy of you who set out like people who did not know each other before,
shall I be able to hide [it], as if I had not seen [and] known [it]?
Without seeing the marriage decorations of the man from the cloud-covered mountain,
are eyes that obtain to be covered by hands also eyes?
Why indeed? I shall surely see with your eyes.
Kajal eyes with waterlily lashes, let your eyes be my eyes indeed.
That is to say,
putting in front one who knows, not knowing of twisting the thread as a dense sign that knows the path(?),
while there is a group of worthy people who know the kinds of collection with much fitness,
so that pallor, rumour and illusory union all
leave [your] soft bamboo-like shoulders,
the man from the mountain that is high in the distance has come,
and may [your] graceful flower kajal eyes flourish now.
